top_comment.text:
When you're making fun of korean english accent, can you give littlest shit 
if there are koreans close by? Maybe it's pretty fucking rude and immature 
thing to do for people your age?﻿
top_comment.author: grey autonomy

comments.text:
Dude, you're being oversensitive. I didn't see anywhere in this video where 
they made fun of the korean english accent.
comments.author: KpopHello1000

comments.text:
+Saerilee You must be so fun to hang around with....God chill out, they 
were just joking around.
comments.author: KpopHello1000

comments.text:
They weren't making fun of the accent. That's the ACTUAL korean 
pronunciation when written out in the korean alphabet I'm pretty sure.
comments.author: Isabel Pineda

comments.text:
You seem quite young and immature, so I'll tell you this: learn to take 
criticism. Learn to recognize that no one is perfect, not even the people 
you look up to. Learn to reflect and think about the criticism, rather than 
immediately denying it, like you did. grey autonomy may have been over the 
top with swearing and name calling, but that doesn't make their comment 
invalid. Good people, loving people, people you look up to and like, 
they're all going to make mistakes. Pointing out the mistakes isn't 
bashing; it's helping them become better people.

You said grey autonomy was making the assumption that people were offended; 
you're making the assumption that no one was offended. You say lack of 
evidence is your evidence, but that's so flawed. There are so many reasons 
why people might not have said anything; maybe they're too shy, maybe they 
don't want to rock the boat, maybe they don't want people telling them to 
suck it up and stop being "oversensitive". 

Hasn't someone ever said someone hurtful to you, but you decided to let it 
go and not say anything because you didn't want to start an argument? 
Haven't you ever disagreed with someone but kept your mouth shut because 
you didn't want to have to defend yourself?

I'm not saying that there are for sure people who were hurt by it 
(personally, being raised by immigrant parents whose English isn't that 
great, I know that it hurts them when people belittle them for it, or joke 
about it, because they're trying, so, actually, yes, I do know for sure 
that some people are going to feel a little hurt. It might not even be 
hurtful enough to comment about it, but that doesn't mean it didn't hurt), 
but the point is that there are people who could be. Even if EYK viewers 
weren't too offended by it, it doesn't make the behaviour itself OK. Like 
grey autonomy said, if I went up to a group of black people and said the n 
word, but none of them were offended by it and maybe even though I was 
being funny, it doesn't make it OK to say that word.

Evidently, this isn't getting through to you because you're too busy 
defending Simon and Martina, but I hope you at least think about what I 
wrote, and I hope that you learn to be more considerate of others.
comments.author: Saerilee

comments.text:
+grey autonomy so? what makes you think Koreans are offended to the point 
that you have to curse at S&M?
comments.author: SHINeeShawol123

comments.text:
+SHINeeShawol123 i don't think i need to be black to be offended when some1 
says the word nigger
comments.author: grey autonomy

comments.text:
+saerilee so.... why are you talking to me? all i said is my opinion, i 
never said my opinions represents every Korean's opinion. if someone was 
offended they could easily comment and say their displeasure, simple as 
that. You should be talking to the guy who is bashing S&M with no proof 
that Koreans are even offended, im pretty sure many Koreans who are even 
nearby cant even understand what S&M mostly say so they cant really be 
offended
comments.author: SHINeeShawol123

comments.text:
Are you so busy sucking up to Simon and Martina that you refuse to believe 
they could say anything that could hurt someone, to whatever degree? You 
really have a lot of growing up to do.

 I believe they're great people who love Korea and love their fans, but 
that doesn't make them perfect. People make mistakes, and people can say 
hurtful things without ever meaning to, because you never know what people 
might have privately experienced. S&M are good enough people that they 
wouldn't want to hurt anyone, so why is it wrong to suggest that, hey, 
maybe making fun of Korean-English accents can be hurtful to someone?

 OP isn't wrong for calling S&M out for doing something that could be 
problematic, even though they definitely should have been calmer and not 
gone straight to angry swearing.
comments.author: Saerilee

comments.text:
+saerilee i think you should be saying all your "education" to the guy who 
posted the first comment because she/he is assuming and insulting S&M for 
his assumptions
comments.author: SHINeeShawol123

comments.text:
I'm not overreacting, I'm pretty calm, especially compared to the OP. I'm 
sorry you can't seem to take patient explaining and education very well. I 
just want people to be more aware of what they do an say and how it can 
affect others, and to, you know, actually use some critical thinking.
comments.author: Saerilee

comments.text: +saerilee arent you overreacting right now? calm down, take a chill pill
comments.author: SHINeeShawol123

comments.text:
And you're also assuming that just because no one said anything, that no 
one is bothered by it.

What if the people who are offended just don't want to say anything? What 
if they're just offended but decide it's not big enough a deal to post 
about it?
What if the majority of Korean viewers are Korean-American or otherwise 
Westernized and are so used to little microaggressions like that, that they 
don't even notice?


And in the big picture, isn't that how bigger problems work? The few people 
who say something about it are derailed and disregarded, told they're 
making a big deal out of nothing, and so other people decide not to say 
anything, and then everyone makes the assumption that nothing's wrong.

Besides
Can you imagine if you were sitting next to people who were making fun of 
you, and you heard it? I'm sure a lot of people acknowledge it if their 
English isn't perfect, but that doesn't mean they want it to but the butt 
of someone's joke, even if it's not meant to offend anyone.
comments.author: Saerilee

comments.text:
+saerilee i know but i dont see any Koreans who are complaining on their 
videos so why does that person think Koreans are offended? he/she's just 
assuming
comments.author: SHINeeShawol123

comments.text:
+SHINeeShawol123 Well you don't represent every single Korean out 
there......just because you're not offended it doesn't mean that everyone 
else isn't. I can see why people would be offended by it. It's very Western 
Imperialist to make fun of, even if it's not MEANT to be malicious, accents 
and mispronunciations.  (Although, OP needs to calm themselves a little and 
maybe try calling out without calling names and sounding like you're 
attacking.....)
comments.author: Saerilee

comments.text: why? im Korean and I don't mind it.
comments.author: SHINeeShawol123

comments.text: i meant the other guy of course
comments.author: Patricia Balanquit

comments.text: Simon? they are married xD i hope he likes her xD
comments.author: Megan Lykins

top_comment.text: So... basically Snakes and Lattes in Korea? Awesome.﻿
top_comment.author: Mickie Halpern

comments.text:
+Saerilee Went to Castle the other day. Loved the place! People were really 
nice and we spent actually 3.5 hours there.  Still pretty darn good! :D
comments.author: takatomon

comments.text:
+takatomon Yeah but it's only $2.50. I don't think you'd be there for more 
than a couple of hours. In any case, I recommend the place for its game and 
staff but not so much the coffee. The desserts are good though, and they've 
recently started offering alcohol too (obs for those of age)
comments.author: Saerilee

comments.text: +Saerilee Doesn't Castle charge by the hour?
comments.author: takatomon

comments.text:
+Sandra Jinki Yep! It is. It's a fun place, though I haven't been there in 
a loooong time.
+saerilee That's the one by Red Room, right? :)
comments.author: Mickie Halpern

comments.text:
+Sandra Jinki Try Castle (it's near Kensington Market), I usually go to 
that one, since I've heard that it's actually better than Snakes and 
Lattes. It's quite nice there, and the staff are really great, you can ask 
for recommendations and they'll spend some time teaching you how to play.
comments.author: Saerilee

comments.text:
i have been meaning to visit snakes and lattes in Toronto, is that the one 
you are talking about, if so how is it. the atmosphere is general
comments.author: Sandra Jinki

captions.text:
It's time for, Wonderful Adventure Now Korea:
the board game edition.
(Can you count how many dings you hear in this video?)
So, it's a Friday night in Seoul, what do I want to do?
Do I wanna go to a club? Do I wanna go dancing or drinking?

Or, do we want to film a WANK, in 
 which, I can even out the masculinity,
because last time we went to a princess cafe, and I was extremely bored.

Lots of guys said they wanted to go to a 
 princess cafe too, so it's just you, Mister.
So, now we're gonna do something a little bit more... manly.
So, my kind can participate in... We're going to a board game cafe.
Yeah. So, as you guys can see here: board game cafe (Korean-like accent)

And not only that, we actually also invited a friend 
 of ours, another man to help us WANK.
So, here, we have our wanking partner Ryan.
What's up? What's Up? (Ryan)
[Martina] We've got two guys WANKing with us. And by us, I mean me.
[Simon] It's definitely a group WANK today.
[Martina] It's pretty much exactly like it sounds like.

It's a cafe filled with board games, and 
 you pay to play in that place.

[Simon] And, we're gonna show you what it's 
 like. It's gonna be lots of fun.
[Martina] Yeah we're gonna compete and definitely get really grumpy with each other.
[Ryan] And I'm gonna win. [Martina] Are you? [Simon] I doubt it.

(Martina) I don't know about that.
[Simon] Since you suck at everything. Let's go!

[Martina] Uh, oh.
[Both] Nananana.
Nananana. (Weakly)
Oh my god. Seriously. There are so many awesome games to play. Battleship.

[Martina] Can you play Battleship with more than two people?
[Simon] No.
[Martina] Oh my god. This is the game of LIFE.
You know what? Life is actually really complicated.

[Martina] Is it? 
[Ryan] It's one of the more complicated card 
 games. There is so much you need to know.
And it's all in K-or-ean. (Stretches the word)
[Simon] We're gonna die.

We've spent like ten minutes of us deciding 
 and we decided on this one. Upongo.

You've played this before, right?
[Ryan] Yeah, once.

That's a Korean board game and that's an accident. We 
 actually want to play this game. (Actually it's Swedish)
Ok. Let's grab a seat and some food and drinks to go with it.
(African themed music)
[Martina] It's like Friday night.... (Simon talking over Martina)
Everybody, let's get hammered. (repeat)

We just want to show you some good old fashioned 
 board game fun. This is what cool people do.
[Simon] Stop swearing. (Another bleep for Martina)
[Martina] I can't swear on camera? I can't, can I?

(Ding) [Martina] Ok. so basically, you pay by hour and then 
 if you go over the hour, you pay more.

And then you have to get a beverage of some kind, 
 which is why we all have... beverages (twinkling sound). Beverages.

Let's start the game. We're playing Obongu.
[Martina] No, we're playing Ubongo.

[Ryan] I thought...you've been here long enough to read 
 it (correctly). [Martina] OOOOhhhhhh. There you go.

Ok. I don't actually know how to play this game.
Martina: Ryan 
 knows how to play this game. (So many dings)

[Ryan] I think I know how to play this game. In translating 
 it, it's to win a wife. [Martina] Really? [Ryan] Nooooo.
(Laughter)
[Martina] Win a wife from Africa! (Haha)

[Ryan] When you roll, that line. So, you have to 
 use only those four to fill up that space.

[S,M] Oh, ok. [Martina] It's kind of like Scattergories. 
(N.A. game) Gotcha.
[Ryan] Scattergories but with Tetris pieces. (Another NA game)

[M] The first player to solve it in time gets to move his pawn 
 up three rows. They didn't explain the gems part guys. (More dings)

(They are trying to sing the theme song to Jem 
 and the Holograms, a US animated TV show)

[R] There is another 'Misfits' in there. (In the lyrics)
[M] Sorry.

[R] There is another 'Misfits' in there. (In the lyrics)
[M] Sorry.

[M] So, we're starting.
[S] 3, 2, 1. (clock ticking)

[S] Mask.
[M] African mask.

[M] Oh, dear god. My hands are all shaky from anticipation.
(Clock ticking)

[S] Oh, I'm missing a piece.
[M] No, you're not.
[S] I don't have the long brown one. And...
(Ryan's the first one done)

[S] (incoherent speech)
[M] Son of a donkey (mild swear)

[S] What in the blue farts (Martina interjects "I know") 
 am I supposed to do here?
(Simon's done next.)
[M] That was more hits than normal. Hey!!

[R] 3,2,1.   [M] Weird, looks like a gazelle. 
 [S] That's a gazelle. (looks like a deer)

[R] It's stressful just picking out the pieces.
[M] I 
 know. [R] Jinsu. (He's done.)
[M] What the?

[S] I don't like playing this game with this... [R] (Manly 
 noise) Puzzle Master. Ooh, who's not the Puzzle Master.
.
[S] Intoxication. 3,2,1
I'm sorry Ducky. [M] You're not that sorry. (whines while piano plays)
Bat, oh, shield.

Kimchi, hey bitches.
What?? no way.

[M] (laughs)

Go. Mask. (S,M humming) [S] Oh man, screw everything

[R] Hyuna. [M] Wow, fantastic baby! [Both] OOOhhhhhhhh.

Nooooo. I was trying to think of anything! ok, 
 well Simon... is not gonna win this one.
[S] Why? Why won't you go in when I want you to?
[M,R] Squiggle. [S] Snake, guys.
Shazam! I mean...um, Kimchi. [M] Hahah. [R] Use shazam.
[M] Bubble Pop! Yes!!! [S] bubble pop, eh?
[M] Ohhh. You got some payback, Ryan.
[S,M] Nanana. Just tell me, why? Why? (MBLAQ's 'Cry')
Ready, guys? [S] Uh, huh. [M] This is a big one.
Hands. [R] Who,who. Who,Who,Who. [M] Already? What? (S,M Groan)
There's no point in continuing. No, I won.

Alright, but I still get a point still. [S] You get

(M sings) Let me see you ya,ya,ya,ya. [S] Only 3 hits. 
 You don't get 4 hits. It's not the same.

[M] Supa, Supa. Naaahhh. (M,R sing pooh, pooh)
[S] I don't want to wear this.
[R] Pop-the-Pirate. [M] I've never played this game before.

[M] Ok. We're playing KING WANG-JJANG. You shove in the knife and he 
 pops out at you if you hit the button. I don't know.
[R] Why is it called 'King'?

We're only doing one round of this and 
 whoever loses it gets the Pooh-Pooh hat.
[S] Me first.
[S] It's hard.

[M] Oh my god. I'm so uncomfortable with this game. 
 [S] We should really get close to this.
[M] No. It's gonna like. I'm so scared guys.
[M] I can't. [R] I think we should all be closer. [M] No.

[M] It's gonna poke our eyes out. No. [R] It's 
 just gonna go straight up. [S] No, it's not.
[R] Why is it facing me? Facing you is worse.
[M] OMG, we're really like, running out of options here.
[S] Martina loses, hey!   [M] Angohayeo. (?) (Korean) No!
[Drums] Pooh, pooh.
Don't touch anything. It can explode at any moment. Ok.

[S] Is this the game we're playing? [R] This 
 is even scarier than the last one.

[M] We're gonna be the screaming table. Everyone is playing intelligent 
 games, and we're in the corner screaming like little girls.
[S] So, this is a game of torture and it's exploiting your childhood fear.

[M] Simon's scared of balloon popping. [S] This is essentially 
 what we had back home. This is so terrible.

[M] Did you know that? He's terrified. [S] I hate this so much.
[M] You don't 
 need to explain it just roll the die. (Dice is plural). Roll it.
[S] Why did I pick this? [R] Yeah, you picked it too.

[R] Well, not really. She just brought it over. 
 [S] Yeah, she's like hey, play this game.

[M] Simon touched it and she's like oh, you 
 should play this game. It's the worst.

OMG, I'm so uncomfortable here. OMG, I hate this

[M] What if it hits me in the face?
Safe! [R] How is that fair? This is such a terrible game.
[S] This is a terrible, terrible game.

1,2,3. Nooo. Two. That is my sweater. [S] 
 That's our sweater. We're husband and wife.
3. Nooo. [M] I'm not playing anymore.

[S] I hate that game so much. [M] No. 
 You betrayed me. (It popped on her turn)
Why did I get off the ride? (Fake crying/whining)
[S] Ah,You missed it. [M] I hate this game.
(Simon voicing) So all together, we played for almost 2 hours.

we got a whole bunch of drinks and it cost us 19,000 won for the 3 of us; which is like 
 under 20 bucks. I think that's pretty fun to play a whole bunch of games and to pop a balloon,
and to pee ourselves a little bit in the process.

So, that's it for this week's Wonderful Adventure Now 
 Korea.
That last game was not wonderful at all.
[M] Ok, seriously, who picked that game?
[S] Who invented that game? [M] Didn't Simon pick it?

[R] Simon picked it. [S] No, I touched it and then the girl's like hey,

[M] I think we should bring back our

And they have a lot of other games that you could play, also,

But we weren't gonna film like 3 hours of us playing Catan.
Or should we? Or should we?
This was a really awesome time. We're gonna definitely come back here. Yes.

Ryan is the big winner here. He never actually

First, second, I should go down one more level to third.

I think I got off that makes for a better

.......This is the best. [M] Would you like to go to princess
